author: Hillel Fuld
title: Forget blood tests - this Israeli company is betting on saliva
text:
Dr. Guy Krief wants to improve health care accessibility and enable early detection and monitoring of certain diseases and conditions, and he is using saliva to do it.
The co-founder and deputy CEO of Salignostics says that making saliva a viable diagnostic medium is crucial as personalized, at-home health care becomes increasingly essential.
Krief explains that traditional diagnostics often rely on blood, urine or tissue samples, which can be invasive, expensive and time-consuming, while saliva-based diagnostics are non-invasive, cost-effective and user-friendly. In addition, they offer the potential for at-home and point-of-care testing.
The technology used by his company, Krief explains, "addresses the challenge of saliva’s low biomarker concentration, making it a reliable alternative for detecting a wide range of diseases—from pregnancy to infectious diseases and even cancer."
Salignostics was founded in 2017 in Jerusalem by a team of five researchers from the Hebrew University specializing in saliva research. "We recognized the untapped potential of saliva for diagnostics, but its biological complexity posed challenges. Our breakthrough was developing a patented technology that made saliva-based diagnostics as reliable as traditional blood tests—without the invasiveness, cost and logistical issues.," Krief told Ynetnews.
Krief's role at Salignostics centers on shaping commercial strategy, forging key partnerships, and securing investments. His expertise spans the field of saliva-based diagnostics, and he has led efforts to scale innovative medical technologies on a global scale.
He says that Israel's biotech success lies in the fact that the country, home to world-class academic institutions like the Hebrew University and Weizmann Institute, has a strong culture of innovation and where "questioning the status quo is encouraged." In addition, he cites the government and military R&D programs that nurture skilled entrepreneurs.
Krief says that the success in closing global deals he and his team at Salignostics managed stems from "a combination of scientific credibility, strategic partnerships, and market insight."
Among the ways that this was achieved, he says, was proving the company's technology through successful products like Salistick, the first saliva-based pregnancy test with CE, UKCA, and TGA approvals, allowing them to be sold in EU countries and Australia. In addition, the company leveraged its proprietary saliva-processing platform, which enables novel clinical applications like saliva-based pancreatic cancer detection.
The company also implemented the "Salignostics Inside" model, which allows other diagnostic companies to integrate its technology into their products, expanding market reach and accelerating adoption.
As part of this success, Salignostics was featured in Time Magazine in October 2023, which presented its Salistick as one of the 200 best inventions of 2023.
"Time Magazine featured us because our saliva-based diagnostics represent a transformative shift in health care," Krief explains. "Our technology allows for non-invasive, user-friendly self-testing, aligning with the growing trend of home-based health care. Time recognized the potential of our innovation to make advanced diagnostics as intuitive as checking one’s temperature, validating the broader vision of accessible, at-home diagnostics."
It has not all been smooth sailing, however, and Krief acknowledges that "scaling a biotech company comes with its challenges.
These challenges include: Navigating complex regulatory approvals across various global markets; Educating the market on the reliability of saliva-based diagnostics; and Ensuring manufacturing scalability without compromising quality.
He adds that "balancing scientific innovation with commercialization has been an ongoing challenge, requiring continuous refinement of our product pipeline and partnerships to meet both consumer and regulatory demands."
Krief and Salignostics have learned some valuable lessons along the way. One of those lessons is to not underestimate regulatory timelines, which delayed the company's entry into the market. In addition, the company faced some early-stage production challenges as it scaled manufacturing to meet demand.
The company also invested heavily in its COVID product, SaliCov, which didn't achieve high sales due to the end of the pandemic and the influx of low-cost nasal swab tests.
"Despite these setbacks, we gained invaluable insights that helped us refine our core technology and better position ourselves for future success," Krief says.
Krief says there are some important trends to pay attention to in the world of biotech, many of which are taking off in Israeli biotech companies.
Personalized medicine and diagnostics are key going forward, and his company is meeting this challenge. "Saliva-based tests are a key enabler of personalized health care, offering at-home monitoring and early disease detection," he explains.
'Technology should address a clear market need, ensuring it’s not just innovative but also practical and impactful'
Another popular trend is digitalization and connected health care. Integrating home diagnostics with telemedicine is crucial for future health care solutions, according to Krief. At the same time, he explains, Precision diagnostics, particularly for cancer treatment, are becoming increasingly important. In addition, combining diagnostics with pharmaceutical care to allow real-time monitoring and therapy adjustments is crucial.
Get the Ynetnews app on your smartphone: Google Play:
https://bit.ly/4eJ37pE| Apple App Store:https://bit.ly/3ZL7iNvKrief has advice for an entrepreneur who is starting a tech company today. First, he says, the start-up should focus on solving a real, meaningful problem. "Technology should address a clear market need, ensuring it’s not just innovative but also practical and impactful," he explains.
He cautions the entrepreneur not to start business development before he or she has solid technology. "It’s critical to have a reliable product or solution before pursuing partnerships or customers. Premature business development can lead to misalignment and wasted resources," he warns.
At the same time, he says, "don’t be afraid to target a 'dreamy' product that could change the entire market. Aim for disruptive innovations that have the potential to reshape industries. Also, target multi-billion-dollar markets where your solution can have a widespread impact."
In addition, hire the best consultants and subcontractors you can afford for core issues like regulatory, intellectual property, accounting and legal, he says.

organizations.name: the Hebrew University and Weizmann Institute

author: Canadian Press
title: Mark Carney would be 'outstanding' addition to federal politics, Trudeau says
text: OTTAWA — Mark Carney would be an "outstanding addition" to federal politics, the prime minister said Thursday, in response to speculation that he is trying to recruit the former Bank of Canada governor to join his cabinet. Trudeau was asked about the possibility of replacing Chrystia Freeland by making Carney his new finance minister during a press conference at the NATO summit in Washington, D.C. Rather than deny the possibility, Trudeau praised Carney and said he's been talking to him about joining federal politics for years. "I think he would be an outstanding addition at a time when Canadians need good people to step up in politics," Trudeau said. But he also emphasized that he has full confidence in Freeland. "In regards to Chrystia, she has been a close friend and ally and partner in doing really big things for Canada and will continue to be," he said. In French, Trudeau said he was "always open" to having other people join the party. A source in the Prime Minister's Office, who spoke under condition of anonymity because they were not authorized to speak publicly, said the suggestion that Trudeau is thinking about replacing Freeland with Carney is "totally false." The idea of Carney running for the Liberals has been a constant discussion in Canadian political circles for years, and he himself has not ruled out the possibility of one day seeking the Liberal leadership. Speculation about a role for Carney, either in the Liberal cabinet or at the helm of it, has run rampant since the Liberals lost a long-held seat in a Toronto byelection last month. Most thought the seat would be a safe one for the Liberals, and the loss sparked calls for Trudeau's resignation from within and outside the party. Despite the criticism, Trudeau has pledged to lead the Liberals into the next election. Carney's supporters see him as a strong economic candidate, as the Liberals struggle to address the growing expense of basic needs in Canada and defend against criticism about government spending. Conservatives have already taken aim at Carney, and even called for him to appear at a parliamentary committee in April so they could grill him about his plans for government economic and fiscal policy. This report by The Canadian Press was first published July 11, 2024. Laura Osman, The Canadian Press

author: Get News
title: Ascendant Celebrates 30 Years of Excellence in Managed IT Services | User | bigspringherald.com
text:
Central New Jersey - Ascendant, an award-winning managed IT service provider headquartered in the heart of Central New Jersey, is proud to celebrate an impressive milestone: 30 years of providing unparalleled technology solutions to businesses across the region. Since its inception in 1994, Ascendant has been at the forefront of the IT services industry, offering an award-winning managed IT service package that consistently sets the standard for excellence, reliability, and innovation.
Three Decades of IT Leadership
From its humble beginnings, Ascendant has grown into a dominant force in the managed IT services sector, driven by a relentless commitment to helping businesses leverage technology for growth and efficiency. Over the years, Ascendant has expanded its reach, now boasting a robust team of over 35+ highly skilled technicians stationed throughout New Jersey. This growth is a testament to Ascendant's dedication to providing responsive and personalized service to each of its clients.
Award-Winning Managed IT Services
Ascendant's success is underscored by its comprehensive suite of managed IT services, which has garnered numerous prestigious awards. The company's flagship service package is designed to address the complex and evolving needs of modern businesses, ensuring optimal performance, security, and scalability.
By entrusting their IT infrastructure to Ascendant, clients are free to focus on their core business activities, confident in the knowledge that they are supported by industry-leading expertise.
Among the accolades Ascendant has received are significant awards from respected industry bodies, including Clutch, Channel Futures 501, and MSSP Alert Top 250. These awards recognize Ascendant's excellence in service delivery, customer satisfaction, and innovation in managed IT services. Such recognition from the industry's most authoritative voices is a clear indicator of Ascendant's leadership and commitment to excellence.
Cybersecurity: A Fortress in the Digital Age
In an era where cyber threats loom larger than ever, Ascendant stands as a vigilant protector for businesses across New Jersey. Our cybersecurity solutions are at the forefront of our award-winning managed IT service package, offering robust defenses against a myriad of digital threats. With advanced threat detection, risk assessment, and incident response capabilities, Ascendant ensures that its clients' digital assets and data remain secure against cyber threats. Our commitment to cybersecurity excellence not only safeguards operations but also instills confidence among our clientele, knowing their businesses are fortified by leading-edge protection.
Strategic IT Consulting: Navigating the Future of Business Technology
Ascendant's IT consulting services represent a cornerstone approach to managed IT, providing businesses with the strategic guidance necessary to navigate the complex landscape of modern IT infrastructure technology and support. Our team of seasoned consultants works closely with clients to understand their unique challenges and objectives, crafting tailored strategies that leverage the latest technological innovations to drive growth and efficiency. Whether it's optimizing IT infrastructure, navigating cloud migration, or implementing new software solutions, Ascendant's IT consulting services ensure that businesses are perfectly positioned to capitalize on the opportunities of the digital age.
24x7 IT Support Desk: Uninterrupted Excellence Around the Clock
Understanding that technology challenges don’t adhere to the typical 9-to-5 schedule, Ascendant offers a 24x7 IT support desk, providing our clients with round-the-clock peace of mind. This dedicated support ensures that any IT issue, no matter how small or complex, is addressed promptly and effectively, minimizing downtime and maintaining operational continuity. Our team of expert technicians is always just a call or click away, ready to deliver rapid, reliable assistance at any hour. This unwavering support underscores Ascendant's commitment to excellence and customer satisfaction, setting us apart in the managed IT services industry.
A Team of Expert Technicians
At the heart of Ascendant's success is its team of over 35 technicians, each bringing a wealth of knowledge and experience to the table. This dedicated team is the backbone of Ascendant's operations, providing swift, effective, customized IT solutions to a diverse clientele. Through continuous training and professional development, Ascendant ensures that its technicians are equipped with the latest skills and technologies to meet the ever-changing demands of the IT landscape. Ascendant’s ongoing employee training keeps their technical team ahead of the curve when it comes to modern business IT solutions.
Comprehensive Solutions for Modern Businesses
Ascendant's managed IT service package encompasses a wide range of solutions tailored to the specific needs of each client. From proactive network monitoring and cybersecurity defenses to cloud services and strategic IT consulting, Ascendant offers a one-stop-shop for all things IT. This holistic approach allows businesses to harness the power of technology to drive innovation, enhance efficiency, and secure their operations against emerging threats.
A Commitment to Customer Success
Customer satisfaction has always been at the core of Ascendant's business philosophy. Over the past 30 years, Ascendant has built lasting relationships with clients across various industries, earning a reputation for reliability, responsiveness, and exceptional service. By partnering with Ascendant, businesses gain not just a managed IT service provider but a trusted advisor committed to their success in the digital age.
Looking Forward
As Ascendant celebrates this significant milestone, the company looks to the future with optimism and a renewed commitment to innovation. With the IT landscape evolving at an unprecedented pace, Ascendant is well-positioned to continue leading the way in the managed IT services industry. The company is dedicated to exploring new technologies, expanding its service offerings, and enhancing its customer service to meet the needs of businesses today and in the future.
About Ascendant
Ascendant is a leading managed IT service provider based in Central New Jersey. With 30 years of experience, a team of over 35 expert technicians, and a track record of industry recognition, Ascendant offers comprehensive IT solutions that drive business success. From cybersecurity and cloud services to network management and strategic consulting, Ascendant is committed to delivering excellence and innovation in managed IT services.
For more information about Ascendant and its services, please visit ascendantusa.com or contact Matthew Franzyshen.

La Liga MX no pudo repetir la dosis y la MLS tomÃ³ revancha de lo sucedido el aÃ±o pasado, para llevarse el triunfo 3-1 en el Juego de Estrellas 2025, celebrado en el Q2 Stadium de Austin, Texas.
Las figuras del fÃºtbol mexicano se quedaron cortas en esta nueva ediciÃ³n del All-Star Game, pues tambiÃ©n fueron derrotados en el Skills Challenge y se mostraron lejos de llevarse el triunfo en el duelo.

Mientras que Sergio Canales generÃ³ peligro para la Liga MX con un disparo que obligÃ³ a Brad Stuver a intervenir. El Piojo Alvarado tambiÃ©n intentÃ³ desde lejos, pero sin Ã©xito.

author: Sarah Kogel-Smucker
title: Amid scorching heat, Moore’s order lays foundation for efficient, clean cooling
text:
By Sarah Kogel-Smucker ,
5 hours ago A man cools off in a Manhattan fountain in June, as excessive heat has gripped the East Coast this summer. The weather is just another reason to applaud Maryland's zero-emission HVAC standards. Photo by Spencer Platt/Getty Images
The first day of summer in Maryland came with a warning : Code Red—Extreme Heat.
Across the state — from the panhandle to Montgomery County to the Eastern Shore – residents endured temperatures above 90°F. This heat wave caused more than 1,600 emergency room visits in one day throughout the mid-Atlantic. Since then, the Washington metro area has endured weeks more of temperatures above 90°F, peaking at 104 degrees in both D.C. and Baltimore.
The record-breaking heat shows that we must prepare now for the extreme conditions caused by climate change, especially as EPA analysis shows that heat waves are occurring longer and more frequently than before.
Fortunately, the first step toward universal clean cooling was taken when Gov. Wes Moore signed a visionary executive order ordering the Maryland Department of the Environment to develop zero-emission heating equipment standards (ZEHES) this year. The directive will ensure that all new HVAC systems in Maryland will soon be heat pumps, delivering highly efficient heating and cooling.
Heat pumps are an essential component of any strategy to make homes more resilient to extreme heat. Heat pumps use 18% less electricity compared to central air conditioning, providing lifesaving cooling amid peak summer heat at a lower cost. Upgrading to a heat pump could save families $705 per year on average on their utility bill, with a further $350 in savings when residents upgrade to a heat pump for water heating.
For low-income households who spend six times as much of their annual income on energy bills as Marylanders as a whole, these energy-saving heat pumps could offer financial relief.
The governor’s executive order does not impact existing heating equipment. Instead, after a date certain new systems would have to employ efficient heat pumps. This gives Maryland residents and businesses time to plan ahead toward their next HVAC system and the option to stack new rebates from EmPOWER Maryland along with federal rebates and incentives. It also sends a clear signal to contractors, installers, retailers and manufacturers to prepare today for higher demand for heat pumps.
These newly available rebates and incentives are important for underserved communities. The passage of HB 864 unlocks new state-level funding for heat pumps and helps low-income families, including those living in multifamily housing, to access whole-home retrofits and electrification.
Montgomery County has lead the way through its Healthy, Efficient, Electrified, Climate-Adapted Pilot (HEECAP), which funds competitively selected community partners to reduce emissions, provide gap funding for health and safety repairs and offer climate adaptations for low- and moderate-income homes, including the installation of heat pumps. The county’s Building Energy Performance Standards will encourage heat pump adoption in larger buildings. Maryland policymakers must work with counties and local stakeholders to ensure that these rebates and incentives are easy to navigate, saving people time and money.
The efficient heating equipment also addresses Maryland’s poor air quality. Fossil fuel heating equipment emits nitrogen oxides (NOx), a key ingredient of ozone pollution or smog. Replacing fossil fuel equipment in homes with cleaner electric technologies will bring urgent relief to Marylanders, particularly low-income and communities of color, who have had to shoulder many of the health and economic costs of this air pollution.
In 2017 alone, outdoor building pollution caused an estimated 163 premature deaths . Pollution from fossil fuel equipment in the Baltimore region is responsible for 3,500 cases of respiratory symptoms, 6,500 lost days at work and $1.3 billion in health impacts annually.
Despite the health impacts of fossil fuels, Maryland residents have subsidized for-profit methane gas companies for decades, artificially lowering the cost of fossil fuel heating equipment. This profitable status quo benefits shareholders while propping up an aging, sprawling gas pipeline that will soon become obsolete.
Gov. Moore’s executive order, however, charts a better path forward, one that is not beholden to the gas industry’s interests and recognizes the writing on the wall: a move to healthier, more efficient electric equipment. Highly efficient heat pumps are already proving to be a cost-effective and popular choice among Marylanders, with 54% of households on track to adopt the technology by 2030.
At a time when Maryland residents are enduring scorching heat, we can’t rely on inefficient AC systems and fossil fuels to bring relief. Instead, we must invest in cleaner, healthier homes with highly efficient heat pumps.
Gov. Moore’s executive order lays the foundation to do just that.
The post Amid scorching heat, Moore’s order lays foundation for efficient, clean cooling appeared first on Maryland Matters .
Expand All Read in NewsBreak

author: TBS Report
title: Industry faces dollar crisis, infrastructure hurdles: Shipbreakers  | The Business Standard
text: Dollar crisis and lack of infrastructure are the main obstacles that stand in the way of the shipbreaking industry in Bangladesh now, said Bangladesh Ship Breakers and Recyclers Association (BSBRA) Vice President Zahirul Islam Rinku today (29 November). "Although our sector has made some improvements, the ongoing global slowdown and the dollar crisis have created hurdles. Also, the narrow and dilapidated roads leading to the yards hinder our ability to meet international standards," he said while briefing three advisers of the interim. Industrial Adviser Adilur Rahman Khan, Land Adviser Advocate Hasan Arif, and Industries Secretary Zakia Sultana visited the Arab Ship Recycling Yard at Sonaishari with a view to assessing the shipbreaking industry's challenges and exploring its growth potential. "The industry contributes $100 million annually through exports of various metals and components, boosting several local sectors including steel, rerolling, shipbuilding, aluminium, and furniture," Zahirul said. Industries Secretary Zakia Sultana acknowledged the need for stronger regulations, stating, "Although rules have been made, a law for the shipbreaking industry is essential. The government will consider long-term funding if a formal request is made." She also mentioned that discussions have already taken place regarding the development of connecting roads, with plans to involve LGED or CDAK in the project. Additionally, she confirmed that a study is underway for the construction of the treatment, storage and disposal facility (TSDF) at Mirsarai Industrial City, with JICA funding. After the briefing, the delegation visited the yard to witness the ongoing development activities firsthand.

author: Google Noticias
title: Compadre Washington pede doações de sangue para Anderson Leonardo, do Molejo | EGOBrazil
text: O cantor Anderson Leonardo voltou a ser transferido para a UTI nesta semana e segue sem previsão de alta Compadre Washington , de 62 anos, do É o Tchan , publicou um vídeo na última quarta-feira (24) pedindo doações de sangue para Anderson Leonardo , de 51, vocalista do Molejo, que está internado na UTI de um hospital particular do Rio de Janeiro para tratar complicações de um câncer raro inguinal. “Tenho um pedido muito importante para vocês, nosso irmão Anderson está necessitando de sangue, de qualquer tipo, então, por favor, quem puder ajudar nosso irmão”, pediu Compadre Washington aos fãs. O cantor explicou que as doações de sangue a Anderson são feitas no Hospital Unimed Barra, na Barra da Tijuca, zona oeste do Rio de Janeiro, onde ele está internado. Parar doar sangue ao cantor, é necessário informar o código de identificação 10473433. O vocalista do Molejo trata um câncer na região inguina desde 2022 e foi transferido de volta para a UTI na última segunda-feira (22), devido a uma queda da pressão arterial do artista, que enfrenta um quadro de insuficiência renal. Segundo o boletim médico mais recente, ele segue sem previsão de alta. “O Hospital Unimed-Rio informa que Anderson de Oliveira foi transferido para a unidade de terapia intensiva. No momento, não há previsão de alta do paciente dessa unidade”, informou o boletim assinado por Luiz Fernando Nogueira Simvoulidis, diretor médico da unidade hospitalar, na última segunda. Compadre Washington pede doações de sangue para Anderson Leonardo, do Molejo Informações para doação de sangue para Anderson Leonardo Foto: Reprodução/

author: Sandra García
title: Estas alcaldías "morirán de calor" a 33 grados la tarde de este 10 de mayo, Día de las Madres | MAPA | El Heraldo de México
text: El [calor ](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/5/9/suspenden-clases-en-campeche-este-10-de-mayo-por-ola-de-calor-601641.html)en la Ciudad de México (CDMX) sigue siendo tan intenso que de nueva cuenta este jueves 9 de mayo la capital del país rompió récord en temperaturas máximas. No obstante, todo parece indicar que la situación seguirá muy similar para este viernes. Te contamos cuáles son las alcaldías que podrían llegar hasta los 33 grados Celsius la tarde de este Día de las Madres. Pero antes, valdría la pena recordar que si planeas ir a celebrar con tu mamá este 10 de mayo, es conveniente que no dejen de considerar las recomendaciones emitidas por las autoridades de Protección Civil ante las [elevadas temperaturas](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/estilo-de-vida/2024/5/9/como-eliminar-el-calor-de-tu-recamara-si-no-tienes-ventana-ni-ventilador-duerme-descansa-con-este-truco-601570.html). Algunas de ellas son las siguientes: - utilizar bloqueador solar - evitar las actividades físicas bajo los rayos del sol - no comer en la vía pública - usar colores claros en la ropa - portar lentes de sol, gorra o sombrero Sigue leyendo: [Suspenden clases en Campeche este 10 de mayo por ola de calor](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/5/9/suspenden-clases-en-campeche-este-10-de-mayo-por-ola-de-calor-601641.html) [Cómo eliminar el calor de tu recámara si no tienes ventana ni ventilador, ¡duerme y descansa con este truco!](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/estilo-de-vida/2024/5/9/como-eliminar-el-calor-de-tu-recamara-si-no-tienes-ventana-ni-ventilador-duerme-descansa-con-este-truco-601570.html) CDMX vuelve a romper récord de temperaturas máximas este jueves 9 de mayo Este jueves 9 de mayo la Ciudad de México volvió a romper récord histórico en [calor](https://heraldodemexico.com.mx/nacional/2024/5/9/ola-de-calor-escasez-del-liquido-colonias-de-guadalajara-que-enfrentan-la-falta-de-agua-601487.html). Así lo dio a conocer el Servicio Meteorológico Nacional (SMN) quien a través de sus redes sociales explicó que en el Observatorio de Tacubaya se reportaron 34.3 grados Celsius. Con la situación anterior, quedó rebasada la marca previa de abril de este mismo año de 34.2 grados. Asimismo, se rompió el récord para un día como hoy, ya que fue el 9 de mayo del año 1998 el que estaba en la cima con una temperatura de 33.9 grados. Estas alcaldías "morirán de calor" a 33 grados la tarde de este 10 de mayo, Día de las Madres Por segundo día consecutivo, 13 de las 16 alcaldías de la CDMX tendrán alerta naranja al tener la posibilidad de alcanzar entre los 31 y los 33 grados Celsius de temperaturas máximas. ¿De cuáles demarcaciones se tratan? Te las dejamos en la lista de a continuación: - Álvaro Obregón - Azcapotzalco - Benito Juárez - Coyoacán - Cuauhtémoc - Gustavo A. Madero - Iztacalco - Iztapalapa - Miguel Hidalgo - Tláhuac - Tlalpan - Venustiano Carranza - Xochimilco A esta situación es necesario sumarle que las tres demarcaciones restantes de la capital del país también sufrirán por el calor al tener alerta amarilla por tener el pronóstico de entre los 28 y los 30 grados Celsius. Se tratan de: - Cuajimalpa - Magdalena Contreras - Milpa Alta MAPA de alcaldías que "morirán de calor" a 33 grados la tarde de este 10 de mayo, Día de las Madres

author: Robert Desaulniers
title: Kittitas County Search and Rescue team rescues mountain biker trapped in ravine - NewsBreak
text: SNOQUALMIE PASS, Wash. – A man who fell nearly 500 feet down a ravine was rescued on Sunday by a Kittitas County Search and Rescue team, and by dispatchers who helped him make a tourniquet out of his helmet straps. According to the Kittitas County Sheriff’s Office, at about 11:39 a.m. on July 6, their 911 dispatch received a 911 text that just read “HELP.” The KCSO said dispatchers worked for an hour and a half to communicate with the 51-year-old Seattle man who had sent the text, and learned he had fallen into a deep ravine along No Name Creek while mountain biking in the area of Little Kachess Lake. Deputies said the man had suffered a debilitating injury in the fall, and was bleeding heavily. KCSO deputies said the man told dispatch he wasn’t able to get to his supplies from where he had fallen, and he appeared to be slipping in and out of consciousness. He sent messages to share with his wife and family if he didn’t survive. KCSO said dispatchers were able to guide the man through fabricating a tourniquet using the straps of his bicycle helmet. While dispatch was on the phone with the man, Kittitas Search and Rescue teams were on the way to him. However, it was determined that it would take a rope team hours to reach the man, and he needed assistance much sooner. A helicopter from the King County Sheriff’s Office was flown out to the area and hoisted the man to safety. He was taken to Harborview Hospital in Seattle to be treated for his injuries. KCSO officials thanked search and rescue personnel for coming out on the holiday weekend to help, and the King County Sheriff’s Office for sending a helicopter to help out in the steep terrain. ​COPYRIGHT 2025 BY APPLE VALLEY NEWS NOW. ALL RIGHTS RESERVED. THIS MATERIAL MAY NOT BE PUBLISHED, BROADCAST, REWRITTEN OR REDISTRIBUTED.
topics: Disaster and Accident->accident and emergency incident

title: Hamas Appreciates South Africa's Move Against Israel With International Court of Justice | Sada Elbalad
text:
Ahmed Moamar
On Saturday, the Islamic Resistance Movement (Hamas) appreciated the submission by the State of South Africa of a request to the International Court of Justice (ICJ) to initiate measures against Israel for what it described as “acts of genocide against the Palestinian people” in the Gaza Strip.
The Palestinian movement said in a statement, “We highly appreciate South Africa’s submission of a request to the International Court of Justice to begin investigation procedures with the criminal occupation entity regarding its commission of the crime of genocide against our Palestinian people in the Gaza Strip.”
The movement's statement added, "South Africa's move is an important step to hold accountable the leaders of the entity, the criminals of the era, who committed the most horrific massacres known to humanity in our contemporary history."
Hamas called on "all countries to submit similar files and requests before the competent criminal courts, national and international, against this Nazi entity, as it is a threat to international peace and security, and to ensure that it does not escape punishment for the brutal crimes it committed against children and defenseless civilians in the Gaza Strip."
The International Court of Justice announced on Friday that South Africa had submitted a request to initiate proceedings against Israel for what it described as “acts of genocide against the Palestinian people” in the Gaza Strip.

organizations.name: move against israel with international court of justice
